steps.title: Use a dry, soft rag to clean the glass surface from which you want Rain-X removed.
steps.content: Use a dry, soft rag to clean the glass surface from which you want Rain-X removed. This helps remove loose dust and debris, and reduces the risk for scratches during treatment.

steps.title: Pour equal parts water and white vinegar into a spray bottle.
steps.content: Pour equal parts water and white vinegar into a spray bottle. This mixture will be used to remove Rain-X from the glass surface, since vinegar contains natural cleaning properties that can remove most commercial formulas, including Rain-X.

steps.title: Spray the water and vinegar mixture across the entire glass surface.
steps.content: Spray the water and vinegar mixture across the entire glass surface.

steps.title: Use the rag to rub and work the vinegar solution into the Rain-X problem areas, or across the entire glass surface.
steps.content: Use the rag to rub and work the vinegar solution into the Rain-X problem areas, or across the entire glass surface.

steps.title: Dry the glass surface using another dry, soft rag.
steps.content: Dry the glass surface using another dry, soft rag. This will wipe away the water and vinegar mixture, as well as any remaining Rain-X residue. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Purchase a commercial cleaning product that has the ability to remove Rain-X residue.
steps.content: Purchase a commercial cleaning product that has the ability to remove Rain-X residue. Rain-X suggests using Rain-X Extreme Clean to remove Rain-X from a glass surface. [2] X Research source Other products proven effective at removing Rain-X include Soft Scrub Cleanser, Rain-X Glass Polish, Bar Keepers Friend cleanser, Detailer’s Pro Glass Restorer, and No Touch GS8 Auto Glass Stripper. steps.title: Use a dry, soft rag to clean the glass surface from which you want Rain-X removed.
steps.content: Use a dry, soft rag to clean the glass surface from which you want Rain-X removed. This helps remove loose dust and debris, and reduces the risk for scratches during treatment.

steps.title: Pour several drops of liquid dishwashing soap as needed into a bowl or bucket large enough to clean the entire glass surface
steps.content: Pour several drops of liquid dishwashing soap as needed into a bowl or bucket large enough to clean the entire glass surface

steps.title: Fill the bowl with water.
steps.content: Fill the bowl with water. This formula will be used to clean and wipe down the entirety of the glass surface.

steps.title: Dip the rag into the soap and water mixture, then use the rag to clean the glass surface.
steps.content: Dip the rag into the soap and water mixture, then use the rag to clean the glass surface.

steps.title: Use another dry, soft rag to remove the soap and water mixture from the glass surface.
steps.content: Use another dry, soft rag to remove the soap and water mixture from the glass surface.

steps.title: Dampen a soft sponge or microfiber cloth using water.
steps.content: Dampen a soft sponge or microfiber cloth using water. The sponge or cloth will be used as a buffer to apply the commercial cleaning solution to the glass surface.

steps.title: Apply the appropriate amount of cleaning solution directly to the sponge or cloth.
steps.content: Apply the appropriate amount of cleaning solution directly to the sponge or cloth. You may need to refer to the product’s label for directions.

steps.title: Use the sponge or cloth to rub and work the cleaning solution into the Rain-X problem areas, or across the entire glass surface.
steps.content: Use the sponge or cloth to rub and work the cleaning solution into the Rain-X problem areas, or across the entire glass surface.

steps.title: Use water to rinse and remove the cleaning solution from the glass.
steps.content: Use water to rinse and remove the cleaning solution from the glass. You can use a spray bottle, hose with a nozzle, or wet cloth to remove the cleaning solution.

steps.title: Use another soft, dry cloth to completely remove any remaining water or moisture from the glass surface.
steps.content: Use another soft, dry cloth to completely remove any remaining water or moisture from the glass surface. Any Rain-X residue will now be removed from the surface.
